10:17 <kasunbg> hi again. :)  
10:18 <kasunbg> is anyone here who can talk about XWiki's participation on Google Summer of Code 2011 ?  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> I myself don't know anything about gsoc participation. I understand we tried to get a sponsorship but were not chosen as we have been sponsored a few years prior.  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> \*last year  
10:33 <kasunbg> I see.  
10:34 <@cjdelisle> I have not heard any talk about applying this year although I suspect it will happen.  
10:34 <kasunbg> It'd be great if XWiki participate this year.  
10:35 <kasunbg> but does gsoc needs \*sponsoring\*?  
10:35 <kasunbg> google gives $500 to the organisation, right?  
10:35 <@cjdelisle> heh I don't even know how that works. I understand google gives something to the project.  
10:36 <kasunbg> :)  
10:37 <kasunbg> AFAIK, a set of contributors willing to mentor and a program administrator and a good application will be enough!  
10:38 <kasunbg> I saw that XWiki didn't participate last year, but was there in the last 3 years. so curious to know how would this year will be  
10:38 <@cjdelisle> I think last year, google decided to fund other projects instead.  
10:40 <kasunbg> ahh, ok. seems that's what you meant previously too, sorry I misunderstood!  
10:40 <@cjdelisle> http://cjdns.pastebay.com/114933  
10:40 <@cjdelisle> Looking for comments on my proposed change to the DHT protocol :)

13:54 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <+evalica> mflorea: is there a way to stop the loading of a page inside an iframe? I'm using an iframe to include another page inside a html document, but I don't want the user to click on a link inside the iframe and that iframe portion be replaced with the clicked site (in a normal manner the whole page is replaced, not just the iframe part)  
14:40 <+mflorea> evalica: I think the best approach is to listen to the click event on the iframe.contentWindow and stop it (always or just when the target is a link). Otherwise you can stop a window (so including iframe.contentWindow) with window.stop() on most browsers and window.document.execCommand('stop', null) on IE  
14:42 <+evalica> and without JS? target="\_blank" is not w3c valid and is not doing what I need  
14:43 <+evalica> TARGET = "\_blank" | "\_parent" | "\_self" | "\_top" | window name  
14:43 <+mflorea> http://www.htmlcodetutorial.com/linking/\_A\_TARGET\_95y116y111y112y.html  
14:43 <+evalica> I'll use this .. but is not valid ... thanks mflorea - JS is not an option :P  
14:43 <+mflorea> evalica: but how do you insert the \_top?  
14:44 <+evalica> <a target="\_top"  
14:44 <+mflorea> do you control the page that is loaded in the iframe?  
14:44 <+mflorea> I mean the page content  
14:44 <+evalica> I'm writing it  
14:44 <+evalica> :)  
14:44 <+mflorea> ok, in this case it should work  
14:44 <+evalica> yea... thanks a lot  
14:45 <+mflorea> np :)
